TopicTitle: Krash when reverting to vehicle assembly

Articles.Content:
This is the second time this has happened.  I don't have the log file from the first time unfortunately, because when it happened I thought I had somehow closed the game.

No errors, pausing, or otherwise weird behavior.  Game just closes like I'd closed it.

This time it happened when reverting during launch to vehicle assembly.

This wasn't even a big, confusing revert.  Craft was about 15 parts.

Full log: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByNnawSf7zdINUtBeDVpQnJZeVU/view?usp=sharing

Last 16 lines of log:

Spoiler

[LOG 19:23:45.516] 9/15/2017 7:23:45 PM,KerbalAlarmClock,Searching for VOID
[LOG 19:23:45.516] 9/15/2017 7:23:45 PM,KerbalAlarmClock-VOIDWrapper,Attempting to Grab VOID Types...
[LOG 19:23:45.575] -INFO- Tac.EditorController[FF9A7B3A][5303.63]: Start
[LOG 19:23:45.575] -INFO- Tac.LifeSupportModule[FF9A3F0E][5303.63]: OnStart: Editor
[LOG 19:23:45.575] IR: [ServoController] OnEditorShipModified finished successfully
[LOG 19:23:45.588] KerbalEngineer -> ActionMenu->OnDestroy
[LOG 19:23:45.588] KerbalEngineer -> FlightEngineerCore->OnDestroy
[WRN 19:23:45.616] HighlightingSystem : Framebuffer depth data is not available and can't be used to occlude highlighting. Highlighting occluders enabled.
[LOG 19:23:45.625] 9/15/2017 7:23:45 PM,KerbalAlarmClock,Loading Textures
[LOG 19:23:45.631] 9/15/2017 7:23:45 PM,KerbalAlarmClock,Loaded Textures
[LOG 19:23:45.632] 9/15/2017 7:23:45 PM,KerbalAlarmClock,Adding DrawGUI to PostRender Queue
[LOG 19:23:45.633] [UiApp] Awake: EngineersReport
[LOG 19:23:45.633] [UiApp] Awake: KSPedia
[LOG 19:23:45.633] [ApplicationLauncher] OnSceneLoadedGUIReady: scene EDITOR ShouldBeVisible() True ShouldBeOnTop() False iIsPositionedAtTop True
[LOG 19:23:45.633] [ApplicationLauncher] SpawnSimpleLayout: HorizontalRightLeft
[LOG 19:23:45.635] ScaleModList: listSize 41 maxListSize 1295

GameData folder:

System specs in signature.

It's too inconsistent to just revert to stock and see if the problem goes away.  First time it did it was a couple days ago.  A couple of these mods I could live without.

Appreciate a point in the right direction!

Edited September 16, 2017 by Geonovast

It happened again shortly after posting this, so I removed Kerbal Alarm Clock, being the most recent mod.  Thought I was good..

Except it crashed again, this time while entering the Space Center from a ship in orbit.

Log from that crash: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByNnawSf7zdIRUdYLV83RFprbWs/view?usp=sharing
